name: Stubborn Love
description: 10" x 10" Letterpress Print Numbered + limited edition (50) Printed on Crane's Lettra, 110lb Pearl White paper Part of Collection One Designed by Shanda Foisy Pixel Soup www.pixelsoupcreative.com @Pixel_Soup "I find it impossible to choose a 'favorite song of all time.' Rather, each year I tend to gravitate towards that song that I listen to again, and again.... and again. In 2012 it was The Lumineers, "Stubborn Love." The violin cuts deep and captivates your emotion; the assertive guitar raises it's head and catches your attention. Then he starts singing, and you sink back in your chair and realize that he is talking about you; the wildly independent brunette who is easy to fall in love with, but hard to live with. This song is about compromise, tolerance and forgiveness—the kind of reaction driven by gravity, not by choice. Most of the time, you don't know if the heart is being torn apart or put back together. Either way, at the end of the day—the stubborn love is still there." *Printed with enthusiasm by SWASH*

name: Jolene
description: 10" x 10" Letterpress Print Numbered + limited edition (50 quantity) Printed on Crane's Lettra, 110lb Pearl White paper Part of Collection One Designed by Char Davidson Small & Mighty Creative www.smallandmighty.com "One of my favorite songs is Jolene by Dolly Parton. Since this challenge involves a group of talented women, I thought choosing a song by a female singer was appropriate. In listening to the song again and again, one thing that stood out to me was the way Dolly sings "Jolene" throughout the song. She starts on a low note and her voice raises every time she croons "Jolene". This repetitive chorus throughout the song inspired me to construct a pattern with highs and lows. Because the origins of the song are country, I also wanted the pattern to be reminiscent of a quilt." *Printed with enthusiasm by SWASH*

name: Where is the Love?
description: 10" x 10" Letterpress Print Numbered + limited edition (50) Printed on Crane's Lettra, 110lb Pearl White paper Part of Collection One Designed by Deborah Brown Good Luck Place www.goodluckplace.com "I consider the song I chose both brutal and beautiful. It's a rap by The Black Eyed Peas and it decries the state of the chaotic and cold post-9/11 world, pleading with us to make it better. It cuts right through me emotionally, but also gets me up dancing, which is a great combination. I wanted to try to capture the duality, of something rough, dark and ominous against something light and elegant and airy. I depicted love playing peekaboo behind the thick black letters – hidden, but always there. I love language: words, type, calligraphy and graffiti, and tried to portray a kind of rawness and power that I feel in the music. I typically work with more color and with painting and collage, so this minimal palette and the medium of letterpress were new challenges. The fonts I used for this composition are Rockwell Extra Bold, originally produced in 1910 as Litho Antique by the Inland type foundry, and later, with new weights added, by the Monotype Corporation in 1934. and Dorchester Script, also from Monotype, released in 1939." *Printed with enthusiasm by SWASH*

name: Aeolus
description: 10" x 10" Letterpress Print Numbered + limited edition (50) Printed on Crane's Lettra, 110lb Pearl White paper Part of Collection One Designed by Cristy Bittencourt www.cristybdesign.com.br @CristyBDesign "I came across the song Aeolus by Freelance Whales on Youtube and it just felt so magical. It felt like diving in the deep blue ocean and discovering new magical creatures. I was taken back to childhood, when my imagination was my reality. When I listen to it, I fall in love with the sea and its hidden and undiscovered wonders. I imagine myself swimming deep down, hoping something magnificent will present itself to me. It gives me hope that something can still amaze me, and that keeps me going." *Printed with enthusiasm by SWASH*

name: Electric Feel
description: 10" x 10" Letterpress Print Numbered + limited edition (50 quantity) Printed on Crane's Lettra, 110lb Pearl White paper Part of Collection One Designed by Erin Anacker Pixology @pixologyrules www.pixology.is "I discovered Electric Feel by MGMT a while back through a Pandora station. When the song came on, it immediately capture my whole self, almost in a mesmerizing way. There is something about the upbeat rhythm and melodious synthesizer that transports me. In my piece, I wanted to convey the depth of sound, thick bass, and electronic style while capturing the mesmerizing nature of it as well. For whatever reason, it also reminds me of when I lived in Seattle—I snuck in a little something to pay homage to my old town." *Printed with enthusiasm by SWASH*
